task-wr.title: Managing Local Volume Groups
task-wr.shortdesc: You can add, delete, and review local volume groups on a compute host.

context.p: Local volume groups are used to designate physical volumes on a compute host as local storage for use by VMs. You can use the web administration or the CLI to manage them. For web administration interface instructions, see .

prereq.p: Before you can modify the settings for a host, you must lock the host:

context.p: To configure a compute host to provide local storage for use by VMs, add a local volume group with the name nova-local.
The following CLI commands are available for managing local volume groups.

note.p: The only valid groupname is nova-local.

postreq.p: To complete the configuration of a compute host for local storage, you must also add physical volumes to the nova-local local volume group. For more information, see .
